instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.CPUVR_PGOOD_R: What is CPUVR_PGOOD_R? CPUVR_PGOOD_R is a signal that comes from CPU_VR_EN that is necessary along with ALL_SYS_PWRGD to create PM_S0_PGOOD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pulsing voltages not turning on
threads.message:
The customer said this board was put to sleep and ever since then it hasn't turned on. There looks to be no liquid damage after inspecting the board. I get a green light when I plug in the charger but nothing comes on nor does the fan spin(which is common for these 2015's).

I unplugged all the external components(kbd,tpad,screen, etc) except for the dc-in board and I plugged in another one to make sure that wasn't the issue. Here are some voltages I get with no components plugged in
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5.04v then every 3seconds it goes to 5.17v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 0v then pulses to 5.17v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0v then pulses to 5.17v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0v then pulses to 5.17v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0v then pulses to around 1.7v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - steady 12.58v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - constant 3.36v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> - around 0.08v then pulses every 3seconds to 3.32v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - around 0.4v then pulses to 3.32v

Pin 1 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>(<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>) - 0v then pulses to 3.35
Pin 2 (<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PGOOD_R</SIGNAL>) - 0.08 then pulses 3.3v
<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and the traces look perfectly fine.
I checked about 10 spi termination resistors and they all measured the proper resistance. All the areas are spotless so I don't think there was any liquid damage causing this.

I tried booting in smc bypass mode without the battery plugged in. After doing it the fan will spin for like half a second then stop and every few seconds it will keep doing the same pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pulsing voltages not turning on
threads.message: This will suck if it is not a corrupted ROM. Try another <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> from donor board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pulsing voltages not turning on
threads.message:
I put another <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and it still pulses and does the same fan issue in bypass mode. 

Is there any other components that I can try replacing to solve this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pulsing voltages not turning on
threads.message: CPU Vcore pulsing too? I find it hard to believe this "just" happened.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pulsing voltages not turning on
threads.message:
Yes.
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 0v then pulses to around 1.7v.
The only thing I have is their word. There is no liquid damage as I can see.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pulsing voltages not turning on
threads.message: I honestly have no further advice besides check for liquid or check for damaged/missing components.
